member.name: T:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId
member.summary: Ambient correlation ID used to associate information pertaining to a current activity. A single activity engages multiple method calls at different layers. Sometimes it's necessary to identify separate calls belonging to the same activity if shared state is needed.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId.Current
member.summary: Returns current activity correlation ID or a default if not set previously.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.ActivityCorrelationId.StartNew
member.summary: Starts a new activity activity correlation ID by updating ambient context value.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AggregateEnumerableAsync`1
member.summary: Aggregates from a list of already ordered enumerables The ordered result will contain only unique values If comparer/EqualityComparer are not provided the default ones for that type will be used. If the provided enumerables are not sorted already, the behavior is undefined

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AggregateEnumeratorAsync`1
member.summary: Aggregates from a list of already ordered enumerables The ordered result will contain only unique values If comparer/EqualityComparer are not provided the default ones for that type will be used. If the provided enumerables are not sorted already, the behavior is undefined

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1
member.summary: Supports async iteration over a generic collection. Prior to calling Current, MoveNextAsync needs to be called otherwise the behavior is undefined
member.typeparam: The type of objects to enumerate.This type parameter is covariant. That is, you can use either the type you specified or any type that is more derived. For more information about covariance and contravariance, see Covariance and Contravariance in Generics.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1.Current
member.summary: Gets the element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator. If MoveNextAsync has not been called prior to calling current the behavior is undefined If the last MoveNextAsync call returned false then the next call to Current should throw an InvalidOperationException
member.returns: The element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator.

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.IEnumeratorAsync`1.MoveNextAsync
member.summary: Moves the pointer to the next element in the collection.
member.returns: Success status of the pointer move

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AsyncLazy`1
member.summary: Wrapper class representing shorter syntax of Lazy<Task<T>>"/>. Useful when declaring a lazy async factory of value T.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.AsyncLazy
member.summary: Shortcuts to common Lazy<Task<T>> constructor calls

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.ClientVersionUtility.GetNuGetAssemblyVersion
member.summary: Find the current NuGet client version from the assembly info as a string. If no value can be found an InvalidOperationException will be thrown.
member.remarks: This can contain prerelease labels if AssemblyInformationalVersionAttribute exists.

member.summary: Basic log message.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode
member.summary:
This enum is used to quantify NuGet error and wanring codes. Format - NUxyzw where NU is the profix indicating NuGet and xyzw is a 4 digit code
Numbers - xyzw x - 'x' is the largest digit and should be used to quantify a set of errors. For example 1yzw are set of restore related errors and no other code path should use the range 1000 to 1999 for errors or warnings.
y - 'y' is the second largest digit and should be used for sub sections withing a broad category.
For example 12zw cvould be http related errors. Further 'y' = 0-4 should be used for errors and 'y' = 5-9 should be warnings.
zw - 'zw' are the least two digit. These could be used for different errors or warnings within the broad categories set by digits 'xy'.
Groups: 1000-1999 - Restore 3000-3999 - Signing
Sub groups for Restore: error/warning - Reason 1000/1500 - Input 1100/1600 - Resolver 1200/1700 - Compat 1300/1800 - Feed 1400/1900 - Package

member.name: F:NuGet.Common.NuGetLogCode.Undefined
member.summary: Do not display the code.

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.WarningLevel
member.summary:
These are Warning Levels used by NuGet while throwing warnings. These logically correspond to .NET spec at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/13b90fz7(v=vs.140).aspx
We do not have a level 0 as that has no logical meaning of having a warning with level 0.
Severe - This should be used to throw warnings that are just short of being an error.
Important - Lower level than severe.
Minimal - Lower level than important.
Default - Lowest level of warnings. Default NuGet logging will ignore these warnings.

member.returns: True if the exception stack should be displayed to the user. False, otherwise.

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnauthorizedLockFail
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to obtain lock file access on '{0}' for operations on '{1}'. This may mean that a different user or administator is holding this lock and that this process does not have permission to access it. If no other process is currently performing an operation on this file it may mean that an earlier NuGet process crashed and left an inaccessible lock file, in this case removing the file '{0}' will allow NuGet to continue..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnsupportedHashAlgorithm
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Hash algorithm '{0}' is unsupported. Supported algorithms include: SHA512 and SHA256..

member.name: P:NuGet.Common.Strings.UnsupportedHashAlgorithmName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The hash algorithm '{0}' is unsupported..

member.name: T:NuGet.Common.Tokenizer
member.summary:
This class is used to parse string into tokens. There are two types of tokens: variables, e.g. "$variable$", or text. The dollar sign can be escaped using $$. A variable contains only word characters.
Examples: - "a $b$ c" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {text, " c"}. - "a $$b$$ c" is parsed into {text, "a $b$ c"}. - "a $b$ $c" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {text, " $c"}. - "a $b$$c$" is parsed into {text, "a "}, {variable, "b"}, {variable, "c"}. - "a $b c$d$" is parsed into {text, "a $b c"}, {variable, "d"} (because space is not a word character).

member.name: M:NuGet.Common.Tokenizer.Read
member.summary: Gets the next token.
member.returns: The parsed token. Or null if no more tokens are available.

member.param: Directory to make the source relative to.
member.returns: The absolute source path or the original source. Noops for non-file paths.
